comments: Let b(0) be the sequence 1,2,3,4. Proceeding by induction, let b(n) be a sequence of length 2^(n+2). Quarter b(n) into four blocks, A,B,C,D each of length 2^n, so that b(n) = ABCD. Then b(n+1) = ABCDADCB. [After Dean paper.] - _Sean A. Irvine_, Apr 20 2015
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
